case_title: Khawaja GHULAM MUHAMMAD vs AZAD GOVERNMENT OF THE STATE OF JAMMU AND KASHMIR Through Chief Secretary, Muzaffarabad And 2 Others
court_name: Azad Jammu and Kashmir Service Tribunal
respondent: AZAD GOVERNMENT OF THE STATE OF JAMMU AND KASHMIR Through Chief Secretary, Muzaffarabad And 2 Others

key_points.government_action: Absence treated as leave without pay via Notification No.SLG/DS/1903-1897/91 dated 14-5-1991

appellant_claims.leave_rules_violation: Absence of 8 years cannot be regularized under Leave Rules
appellant_claims.seniority_impact: Appellant's rights affected due to relaxation of rules
appellant_claims.rule_reference: Article 113 of KSR - Absence over 5 years results in cessation of service

respondent_defense.medical_leave: Absence due to illness supported by medical certificates
respondent_defense.government_relaxation: Government exercised extraordinary powers to relax rules
respondent_defense.continuation_of_service: Service treated as continuation of previous employment

tribunal_findings.government_powers: Government has authority to relax rules for equitable decisions
tribunal_findings.notification_validity: Notification issued for relaxation is valid and legal
tribunal_findings.leave_rules_application: Rules apply to all government servants unless explicitly stated otherwise
